e4: Adopting the new policy enhances transparency and aligns with ethical financial reporting standards, which can strengthen investor trust over time. Though some short-term confusion may arise, clear communication can mitigate this, ensuring investors understand the true earnings. This shift reduces legal liabilities and improves long-term corporate governance and credibility.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should ensure transparency, accuracy, and clarity, allowing all stakeholders equal access to truthful financial information. It must avoid misleading adjustments or biases, ensuring that every investor, regardless of sophistication level, can make informed decisions. Companies should communicate changes transparently and prioritize long-term integrity over short-term gains.
e6: What steps will be taken to communicate the policy change to all investors, and how will the company monitor the understanding and adaptation among retail and institutional investors to minimize market confusion? Also, how does management plan to address any immediate market reactions and ensure continued investor confidence?
